thread.title: Joel Niemi

author: Joel Niemi
title: Joel Niemi
text:
I've been looking at, reading reviews on, and even buying various multi-tools for the past while. This one isn't quite "holy", but it is nearly the Grail.
The major tools are on Y-wrenches, better than the fold-out multi-tools (in my opinion). The only bits (stored in one of the tool compartments) I need are the screwdriver ones - no torx nor itsy-bitsy allens on my bike. I appreciate the fact that this means fewer little pieces to lose on the roadside. The bit driver appears to my digital micrometer to use 1/4" drive hex bits, widely available.
Crank Brothers sells the 8-mm and 10-mm sockets from their Pika+ separately, and this tool can use them, so my olde byke nuts will use those; I will just re-arrange the little bit of sandpaper and the stick-on patches (or not carry them, relying on a "real" patch kit), to create space for the 8 and 10.
Has nice little foam rubber pad fillers for the tool compartments to eliminate rattles.
It would be better if ... it had a 1/4" square drive, as used on socket wrench sets, on one of the arms. That would enable Many other sizes and kinds of bits and wrenches to interface.
This is a good tool even at list price. The every-so-often promotional price from BTD made it that much sweeter of a deal. Value-wise, it beats the ultra-cheapo ebay $3.99 all-steel mini-boat-anchor fold-out ones by a mile or two.
